srl.corpus
Class Corpus

java.lang.Object
  srl.corpus.Corpus

public class Corpus
extends java.lang.Object

This class wraps Lucene to provide all the tools useful for access to the corpus.

Nested Class Summary
 class Corpus.Overlap
          Used to represent an overlap in tagging
static interface Corpus.QueryHit

query

public void query(SrlQuery query,
                  Corpus.QueryHit collector)
           throws java.io.IOException
Query the corpus

Parameters:
query - The query normally returned from Rule.getQuery()
collector - Every hit is passed to the hit(Document) method of the collector
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There was an disk error with the corpus

query

public void query(SrlQuery query,
                  Corpus.QueryHit collector,
                  StopSignal signal)
           throws java.io.IOException
Query the corpus

Parameters:
query - The query normally returned from Rule.getQuery()
collector - Every hit is passed to the hit(Document) method of the collector
signal - An optional stop signal to abandon the query
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There was an disk error with the corpus

tagSentences

public static java.util.List<SrlDocument> tagSentences(java.util.List<SrlDocument> sents,
                                                       java.util.Collection<RuleSet> ruleSets,
                                                       Processor p)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
Apply the tagging algorithm.

Parameters:
sents - The document as a list of sentences
ruleSets - The rulesets to apply
p - The linguistic processor
Returns:
The document as a list (tags are added as BeginTagToken and EndTagToken objects
Throws:
java.io.IOException

tagCorpus

public void tagCorpus(java.util.Collection<RuleSet> ruleSets,
                      java.util.Collection<Corpus.Overlap> overlaps)
               throws java.io.IOException
Tag the corpus

Parameters:
overlaps - A collection, which this function will add any overlaps it detects to (an overlap is a pair of matches where both matches hit the same token and both matches have one token not matched by the other e.g., [0,4] & [1,5])
ruleSets - The set of rules for named entity extraction
Throws:
java.io.IOException

tagCorpus

public void tagCorpus(java.util.Collection<RuleSet> ruleSets,
                      java.util.Collection<Corpus.Overlap> overlaps,
                      ProgressMonitor monitor)
               throws java.io.IOException
Tag the corpus

Parameters:
overlaps - A collection, which this function will add any overlaps it detects to (an overlap is a pair of matches where both matches hit the same token and both matches have one token not matched by the other e.g., [0,4] & [1,5])
ruleSets - The set of rules for named entity extraction
monitor - Monitors the progress surprisingly
Throws:
java.io.IOException

resupport

public void resupport()
               throws java.io.IOException
Reinitialize the corpus support. This is actually research for word list entry matches, sometimes they get out of sync, I don't know why, hopefully they are fixed now and I just forgot to remove this comment.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
